hero.subtitle: Junior Software Developer
hero.description: I was a teacher for young children (where I learned to have Jedi-level patience), I worked in a kitchen (where the recipe was always 'improvise or die'), I sold cars (without knowing about engines, but with a lot of drama)... and after a thousand jobs I discovered the most addictive of all: programming, where debugging is my new extreme sport.

about.title: About Me
about.p1: Hi, I'm Jesús Gutiérrez García, and my journey into programming began in an unexpected place: teaching.
about.p2: There I discovered the value of communication, patience, and adaptability—skills I now apply in software development.
about.p3: My curiosity for technology led me to study for a Higher Level Certificate in Multiplatform Application Development at IES Ingeniero de la Cierva (2025). I later had the opportunity to intern at SEWAN, developing software for SD-WAN Box with Node.js and React.
about.p4: During this time, I have worked with Java, Python, C#, JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js, and React, as well as databases like MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB. I also apply agile methodologies like Scrum and Kanban, design REST APIs, and use Docker to deploy projects.
about.p5: Artificial Intelligence has become a great ally in my daily work, thanks to tools like GitHub Copilot, Cursor IDE, and ChatGPT.
about.p6: Beyond the technical, I value my ability to explain complex ideas, work in a team, solve problems, and learn continuously.
about.p7: In 2025, I was recognized with an Accésit in the Database specialty at the XV Informatics Olympiad of the Region of Murcia. Today, I continue to explore new technologies with a clear goal: to turn ideas into useful solutions and add value to every project.
about.p8: It is also relevant to mention that I have a recognized 33% disability, which does not impact my mobility or my ability to fully carry out my professional duties. In fact, it has reinforced my resilience and my commitment to overcoming challenges.
